components.content: IMPORTANT: Read the instructions below before you begin. Refer to the procedures for submitting Mortgage intakes in Roostify for more detailed information.
1. Provide your NMLS ID to the Customer, 'I am registered with the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System & Registry (NMLS), and my number is (NMLS ID).'
2. Confirm that the Customer's collateral property is in TD's service area: CT, DE, DC, FL, ME, MD, MA, NH, NJ, NY, NC, PA, RI, SC, VT, or VA.
3. Review product and pricing options with the Customer using the Mortgage rate and payment calculator at td.com/TDHomeLoanMatch.
4. Use a valid email address for each Customer. Never use your personal or work (@td.com) email address on behalf of the Customer - this will cause loan processing delays.

5. Answer all sections completely and accurately.  Use a best estimate if the Customer is unsure of a specific date or dollar amount. Note: Please limit the use of special characters (e.g. apostrophes, hyphens, tildes).
6. Read all required disclosures verbatim to the Customer, such as the ECOA/Other Income.
7. Once ready to submit, click the Submit button once. Saved intakes are not considered complete. If you exit, information entered will be saved up to the last completed page.

components.text: Welcome! Tell us a little about yourself

components.legend: Personal Information
components.subtext: All your information, including your contact information is securely stored, and will never be sold to a third party.
components.hint: To help us verify your information, please use the same name you use to file taxes.

validation.message: This borrower name and email combination is being used on a loan that is already in the pipeline, and this account does not allow more than one loan per borrower. If you think this name/email combo is in error, you can change it in the Personal Information section. You can also enable multiple loans per borrower in the admin console.

components.label: Home phone
components.hint: A phone number is required and should be a number where we can reach you during business hours to finalize your application. By providing your cellular number, you agree to receive text, autodialed and prerecorded messages regarding your account. You can change your preferences at any time.

components.hint: TD Bank customers may be eligible for a 0.25% rate discount on a new Home Equity Line of Credit or Home Equity Loan. Your TD Bank personal checking account will be validated during the application process. If you select a Home Equity Loan, an automatic payment deduction from your TD Bank personal checking must also be set up to qualify. If you plan to open a personal TD checking account, you must open your account prior to loan closing, by going online, by phone or at your local TD Bank.

components.subtext: A co-borrower is a person other than you (who may or may not be a spouse) whose income, assets, liabilities, and credit history are considered to determine creditworthiness for a loan. Co-borrowers have an obligation to repay the loan.
components.hint: The name, email, and phone of your co-borrowers will be used across the application. Use legal names for the fastest process.

components.text: What kind of loan are you looking for?
A selection is required before proceeding.*

components.error_message: Please select required kind of loan

hints.text: Whether buying your first home or your next home, a mortgage is where to start.
Refinance a property that you already own to improve the terms of an existing mortgage (lower rate or shorter term), pay off other debts or get cash.

A revolving line of credit with a variable rate that has a 10-year draw period and 20-year repayment period. Draw all the funds available or only what you need, when you need them, up to your credit limit.
A one-time, lump sum taken out from the equity in your home, to be paid back at a fixed rate with consistent payments over a set period of time.
A Construction loan is used to finance the construction of a new home and—if needed—the purchase of a new lot. Upon the completion of construction, the loan converts to a permanent mortgage.

components.text: Your situation

components.legend: Select only one primary purpose for your loan even if you may use it for a variety of reasons. Select 'Other' for any reasons not listed and enter the reason such as Business, Other Home Purchase or Marital Buyout.

components.label: Do you have a preference for the kind of interest rate you’re looking for?
components.legend: Do you have a preference for the kind of interest rate you’re looking for?
components.hint: If you’re not sure at this time, you can skip this question and discuss with us later.

hints.text: This type of loan has a set interest rate and a monthly payment that will remain the same over the entire duration of the loan. With a fixed rate mortgage, you benefit from a consistent payment that you can budget from.

A mortgage whose rate of interest is adjusted periodically to reflect market conditions. An ARM permits a borrower to lower their initial payments in exchange for the risk of interest rate changes and increased monthly payments due to upward rate adjustments.

A mortgage with low initial monthly payments which gradually increase over a specified time frame. These plans are mostly geared towards young men and women who cannot afford large payments now, but can realistically expect to do better financially in the future. A graduated payment mortgage lets borrowers save at the present time by paying low monthly amounts, however, the overall expense of a graduated-payment mortgage loan is higher than that of conventional mortgages.

components.text: Which loan term is most appealing to you at this time?
components.hint: Shorter terms typically have higher monthly payments, but lower interest rates and less interest paid over the life of the loan. Longer terms typically have lower payments, but higher overall interest. If you’re not sure which one you’d like at this time, go ahead and skip this question and we’ll calculate all the details of your loan together.

components.text: What fixed payment term is most appealing to you at this time?

hints.text: Not available for investment properties

components.text: Will you be taking cash out from this refinance?
components.hint: A cash-out refinance replaces your existing mortgage with a new one for more than you owe on your house. The difference goes to you in cash and you can spend it on home improvements, debt consolidation or other financial needs. You must have equity built up in your house to use a cash-out refinance. In contrast, traditional refinancing replaces your existing mortgage with a new one for the same balance.

components.text: :hoi_auth_header
components.subtext: Homeowners insurance is, and flood insurance may be, required as part of your closing. We have partnered with an independent digital insurance agency to make insurance easy to understand and painless to purchase. By clicking Yes below, you are authorizing us to share your contact information and transaction details with our insurance provider. You are also agreeing to our insurance provider’s Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy. Please note - use of this service is not required to secure financing. Consult with your lender about the other types of insurance that may be required for your subject property (e.g. flood, wind/hail, etc).

components.text: Let's determine your loan amount
components.subtext: To determine your eligible loan amount, we compare your estimated home value to the total outstanding mortgages (or liens) on your property, including this new loan. This is your “Loan-To-Value” (LTV) and your maximum LTV will be based on creditworthiness, property type, occupancy, lien position and loan amount.

components.label: Estimated property value
components.hint: Use your best estimate. For example, compare it to recent sales in your area or use a recent appraisal if you have one. We will arrange an official appraisal of your property later. The appraised value of your property may affect the amount you can borrow.

components.subtext: The full street address, city, state, and zip code is needed in the Property section above to call up Zillow’s estimate. Not all properties have estimates available.

components.label: Estimated max loan amount
components.hint: This is an estimate. Other information gathered after you submit your application may change the maximum amount you are eligible to borrow.

You must read this to your Customer. Please be as detailed as possible as all sources of income are required; exceptions to this requirement are as follows: Alimony, child support or separate maintenance income is not required to be shared unless you want us to consider that income as part of your application. The law allows you to choose whether you want to disclose this kind of income or not.

Do not enter rental income here, that will be included in the Assets section.

components.text: Let's talk about your credit
Please enter your Social Security Number.
components.subtext: We ask for your Social Security Number in order to pull your credit and to verify your identity. We take our responsibility to protect your data very seriously. Your personal information is safely stored on highly secure, encrypted servers.

components.text: Please enter co-borrower's Social Security Number.

components.text: Borrower credit pull authorization
components.subtext: Section 326 of the USA Patriot Act requires us to verify certain information, including your name, legal address, date of birth, Social Security or tax ID number, while processing your account application. We will obtain information and reports about you from CBC Innovis Services, and if applicable, from Equifax Canada Co., at the time of and any time during the application process, and on an ongoing basis, to review and verify your creditworthiness.

Have you or will you be applying for any new credit (e.g. installment loan, credit card, etc.) on or before closing of this loan that is not disclosed on this application?

Will this property be subject to a lien that could take priority over the first mortgage lien, such as a clean energy lien paid through your property taxes (e.g. the Property Assessed Clean Energy Program)?

components.text: About Your Finances

components.label: Are you a co-signer or guarantor on any debt or loan that is not disclosed on this application?
Are there any outstanding judgments against you?
Are you currently delinquent or in default on a Federal debt?
Are you a party to a lawsuit in which you potentially have any personal financial liability?
Have you conveyed title to any property in lieu of foreclosure in the past 7 years?

Within the past 7 years, have you completed a pre-foreclosure sale or short sale, whereby the property was sold to a third party and the Lender agreed to accept less than the outstanding mortgage balance due?
Have you had property foreclosed upon in the last 7 years?
Have you declared bankruptcy within the past 7 years?

components.text: Demographic questions
Disclaimer
components.subtext: The purpose of collecting this information is to help ensure that all applicants are treated fairly and that the housing needs of communities and neighborhoods are being fulfilled. For residential mortgage lending, federal law requires that we ask applicants for their demographic information (ethnicity, sex, and race) in order to monitor our compliance with equal credit opportunity, fair housing, and home mortgage disclosure laws. You are not required to provide this information but are encouraged to do so. You may select one or more designations for Ethnicity and one or more designations for Race. The law provides that we may not discriminate on the basis of this information, or on whether you choose to provide it. However, if you choose not to provide the information and you have made this application in person, federal regulations require us to note your ethnicity, sex, and race on the basis of visual observation or surname. The law also provides that we may not discriminate on the basis of age or marital status information you provide in this application. If you do not wish to provide some or all of this information, please check below.

components.text: You must read this Standard Language disclosure out loud to your Customer: Please be aware that verbal and written communications from TD Bank ordinarily will be in English. This includes applications, account agreements, statements and disclosures, notices concerning changes in terms or fee, and communications related to account servicing.

components.label: Have you read the Standard Language disclosure above to the customer?

components.text: Please enter your Social Security Number.
components.subtext: We ask for your Social Security Number in order to pull your credit and to verify your identity. We take our responsibility to protect your data very seriously. Your personal information is safely stored on highly secure, encrypted servers.

components.text: Please enter co-borrower Social Security Number.
Please enter co-borrower's Social Security Number.

components.content: We ask for your co-borrower's Social Security Number in order to pull their credit and verify their identity. We take our responsibility to protect their data very seriously. Their personal information is safely stored on highly secure, encrypted servers.

components.text: Credit pull authorization
components.subtext: Section 326 of the USA Patriot Act requires us to verify certain information, including your name, legal address, date of birth, Social Security or tax ID number, while processing your account application. We will obtain information and reports about you from CBC Innovis Services, and if applicable, from Equifax Canada Co., at the time of and any time during the application process, and on an ongoing basis, to review and verify your creditworthiness.

components.text: Co-borrower credit pull authorization
components.subtext: Authorizing your lender to pull co-borrower credit right now is not required, but your lender will have to view co-borrower credit report eventually because it's important for them to understand what your debt obligations are.

components.text: You must engage the Home Lending Group to continue. After you submit the intake, call (888) 722-6537 for English speaking customers and (800) 323-6678 for Spanish speaking customers to either complete the loan officer consultation or schedule an appointment for your customer to be called back. IMPORTANT REMINDER: Do not share these phone numbers with your customer; these are for INTERNAL USE ONLY.
